subject: Design
title: Don Norman and the Birth of UX
description: One-minute skill: Don Norman and the Birth of UX.

hook.text: In 1993, Don Norman joined Apple and gave himself a new title: 'User Experience Architect.'

buildup.text: He argued that design isn't just how a product looks â€” it's every moment of using it.

discovery.text: UX includes opening the box, reading instructions, feeling frustrated, and telling a friend about it.

twist.text: Before Norman, 'design' meant appearance. After him, it meant the entire human experience.

climax.text: His book 'The Design of Everyday Things' became the bible of UX design.

punchline.text: UX didn't exist as a field until one person named it.
